alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 22 at 6:35AM CDT until July 22 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... East Central West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 945 AM CDT. * At 635 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Merrydale, Brownfields and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 12 between mile markers 8 and 9. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
